summary: Ergonomics, within the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, pertains to the systematic study of work environments and conditions to enhance worker safety, comfort, and productivity. The EU emphasizes the importance of ergonomics in directives related to occupational health and safety, aiming to prevent work-related musculoskeletal disorders and improve overall organizational efficiency. By integrating ergonomic principles into workplace design, the EU seeks to foster a sustainable work environment that accommodates diverse employee needs. This concept is pivotal in shaping regulations that mandate ergonomic assessments and interventions, thereby ensuring compliance with established health and safety standards across member states.
